page.title: 04GREAT CHARACTERS
page.content: {ALBAN GWYNNE}- Founder of Aberaeron who inherited the Mynachdy fortune in 1805. Used his wealth to build the town. {WILLIAM GREEN}- Early builder of Aberaeron. A native of Aberystwyth he was a staunched Methodist and in 1833 built the Tabernacle Chapel. Green was opposed to mixed bathing and his protest led to a fine of 2 shillings being imposed on anyone found doing so. {BENJAMIN EVANS}- Evicted from Llety Shon, a local farm, for refusing to vote Tory. He later became one of the towns leading business men, owning a flourishing slate and timber business. {DAVID JONES}- Leading 19th century shipbuilder.He had no formal education but was one of the first in Wales to convert a ketch into a schooner.
